title: Drug dealer who hid stash of heroin and cocaine in flower pot in front of police officers is jailed
text:

A hapless drug dealer who hid his stash in a flower pot while in full view of police has been jailed for four years. 
Hannan Shaukat, who is known by the nickname ‘Panda’, was arrested after officers caught him attempting to ditch a huge supply of Class As in the container. 
Patrol officers observed Shaukat acting suspiciously on Milkstone Road , just after 10am on Friday, November 11 last year. Read More Pictured: Moment bungling burglar got stuck in bathroom window 
They followed him and saw him place an item in a pot near to a takeaway, before running away. 
After pursuing and apprehended him, they discovered a snap bag of cannabis on his possession, along with 44 wraps of cocaine and 41 wraps of heroin in the plant pot. 
An investigation found he was selling Class A drugs in the Milkstone and Deeplish areas. Read More Drunken dad-of-one banned from airline for LIFE after going 'purple with rage' on flight 
Shaukat, 21, of Exeter Street, Deeplish, was charged with five counts of drug possession and supply. 
He was sentenced to four years and three months in prison at Manchester’s Minshull Street court on Monday. Like us on Facebook
